page.title: 05A LOCAL FARMER
page.content: MR G FOWLER HAS A 154 ACRE FARM IN THE VILLAGE.HE AND HIS BROTHER ARE THE ONLY FULL TIME EMPLOYEES.HIS GRANDFATHER BOUGHT THE FARM IN 1911 WHEN THE SHEFFIELD ESTATE WAS SOLD.HIS FATHER TOOK OVER IN 1936,AND MR FOWLER IN 1950.HE CAME FROM COTTAM WHERE HIS FATHER HAD A FARM.THE FIRST TRACTOR , A FORDSON MAJOR,WAS BOUGHT IN 1945.HORSES WERE KEPT FOR SOME YEARS AFTER .HE GROWS 110 ACRES OF CORN;20 OF SUGAR BEET;12 OF POTATOES AND 12 OF PEAS UNDER CONTRACT.THESE CROPS HAVE ALWAYS SUITED THE SOIL AND CLIMATE.HE THINKS THEY MIGHT GROW SALAD CROPS AND OILSEED IN THE FUTURE;IF THEY DECIDE TO CHANGE.ONLY 3 MEN ARE NEEDED AT HARVEST TIME,BUT POTATO PICKING EMPLOYS 10 PEOPLE.THE CROPS ARE SOLD LOCALLY.HE HAS HIS OWN CORN AND POTATO STORE.SUGAR BEET IS TAKEN TO THE FACTORY AT BRIGG.
